title: Ferritin cages as building blocks for higher-order assembly through copper–sulfur bonds for HER analysis
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,24791-24796
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA02931C, Paper
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Ruoxuan Sun, Sierin Lim
An approach was reported for assembling higher-order protein structures on a Cu substrate using cysteine-modified Archaeoglobus fulgidus as building blocks for Cu–S bonds. Its assembly mechanism and electrochemical potential were investigated.
